intro: Polycarena rangei, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are small and spiny, providing protection from herbivores. Polycarena rangei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
